name: Mozart
bio: Austrian composer and pianist, Mozart was a prolific and influential figure in classical music, known for works like 'The Magic Flute' and 'Symphony No. 40'.

name: Beethoven
bio: German composer and pianist, Beethoven was a crucial figure in the transition between the Classical and Romantic eras in Western music.

name: Jobs
bio: Co-founder and former CEO of Apple Inc., Steve Jobs was a pioneer of the personal computer revolution and a key figure in the development of the iPhone.

name: Hayek
bio: Austrian-British economist and philosopher known for his defense of classical liberalism and free-market capitalism.

name: Friedman
bio: American economist and statistician who received the 1976 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for his research on consumption analysis and monetary history.

name: Smith
bio: Scottish economist and philosopher, widely regarded as the father of modern economics and known for his work 'The Wealth of Nations'.

name: Dostoevsky
bio: Russian novelist and philosopher, renowned for works like 'Crime and Punishment' and 'The Brothers Karamazov'.

name: Hume
bio: Scottish Enlightenment philosopher, historian, and essayist known for his philosophical empiricism and skepticism.

name: Epstein
bio: American legal scholar known for his writings on torts, contracts, and property rights, and a senior fellow at the Hoover Institution.

name: Coase
bio: British economist and author of 'The Nature of the Firm', awarded the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences in 1991.

name: Da Vinci
bio: Italian polymath of the Renaissance era, known for masterpieces like the 'Mona Lisa' and 'The Last Supper'.

name: Rembrandt
bio: Dutch Golden Age painter and etcher, renowned for his portraits and use of light and shadow.

name: Einstein
bio: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, a pillar of modern physics.

name: Curie
bio: Physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity; first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

name: Newton
bio: Mathematician and physicist recognized for formulating the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

name: Darwin
bio: Naturalist and biologist known for his theory of evolution by natural selection.

name: Lovelace
bio: Mathematician considered the world's first computer programmer for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical computer.

name: Hawking
bio: Theoretical physicist and cosmologist known for his work on black holes and author of 'A Brief History of Time'.

name: Turing
bio: Mathematician and logician who is considered the father of theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence.

name: Branson
bio: Entrepreneur and founder of the Virgin Group, encompassing diverse businesses.

name: Picasso
bio: Spanish painter and sculptor, co-founder of the Cubist movement.

name: Van Gogh
bio: Dutch post-impressionist painter known for works like 'Starry Night'.

name: Monet
bio: French painter and founder of French Impressionist painting.

name: Warhol
bio: American artist and leading figure in the visual art movement known as pop art.

name: O'Keeffe
bio: American artist known for her paintings of enlarged flowers and New Mexico landscapes.

name: Angelou
bio: Poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist known for 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.

name: Shakespeare
bio: English playwright and poet, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language.

name: Hemingway
bio: Novelist and short-story writer known for works like 'The Old Man and the Sea'.

name: Austen
bio: English novelist known for her six major novels including 'Pride and Prejudice'.

name: Dickens
bio: English writer and social critic, created some of the world's best-known fictional characters.

name: Woolf
bio: English writer and modernist, author of 'Mrs. Dalloway' and 'To the Lighthouse'.

name: Frost
bio: American poet known for his depictions of rural New England life.

name: Plato
bio: Greek philosopher, student of Socrates, and teacher of Aristotle, known for founding the Academy in Athens.

name: Aristotle
bio: Greek philosopher and polymath, made lasting contributions to logic, metaphysics, ethics, and politics.

name: Socrates
bio: Classical Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy.

name: Descartes
bio: French philosopher, mathematician, and scientist, famous for 'Cogito, ergo sum'.

name: Kant
bio: German philosopher who developed the theory of transcendental idealism and wrote 'Critique of Pure Reason'.

name: Nietzsche
bio: German philosopher, cultural critic, and philologist known for his ideas on nihilism and the Übermensch.

name: Locke
bio: English philosopher and physician, widely regarded as the father of Liberalism.

name: Rousseau
bio: Genevan philosopher and writer, influential in the Enlightenment and French Revolution.

name: Franklin
bio: Founding Father of the U.S., inventor, and diplomat, known for his experiments with electricity.

name: Jefferson
bio: Principal author of the Declaration of Independence and third U.S. president.

name: Lincoln
bio: 16th President of the United States, led the nation during the Civil War and abolished slavery.

name: Washington
bio: First U.S. president and commander of the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War.

name: Mandela
bio: South African anti-apartheid revolutionary and former president, symbol of peace and reconciliation.

name: King
bio: American Baptist minister and activist, leader in the Civil Rights Movement, known for 'I Have a Dream'.

name: Gandhi
bio: Leader of India’s nonviolent independence movement against British rule.

name: Theresa
bio: Catholic nun and missionary known for her humanitarian work and canonized as Saint Teresa of Calcutta.

name: Tubman
bio: Abolitionist and political activist who rescued enslaved people using the Underground Railroad.

name: Nightingale
bio: Founder of modern nursing and a reformer of hospital sanitation methods.

name: Carver
bio: Agricultural scientist and inventor who promoted alternative crops to cotton.

name: Tesla
bio: Inventor and engineer known for contributions to AC electricity and numerous innovations.

name: Edison
bio: Prolific American inventor best known for the electric light bulb and phonograph.

name: Pasteur
bio: French chemist and microbiologist known for discoveries of vaccination and pasteurization.

name: Fleming
bio: Scottish biologist and pharmacologist who discovered penicillin.

name: Bohr
bio: Danish physicist who made foundational contributions to understanding atomic structure and quantum theory.

name: Copernicus
bio: Polish astronomer who formulated a heliocentric model of the universe.

name: Galilei
bio: Italian physicist and astronomer, known as the 'father of observational astronomy'.

name: Kepler
bio: German astronomer who established laws of planetary motion.

name: Faraday
bio: English scientist who contributed to electromagnetism and electrochemistry.

name: Maxwell
bio: Scottish scientist known for formulating the classical theory of electromagnetic radiation.

name: Mendel
bio: Austrian scientist and monk, founder of the modern science of genetics.

name: Lavoisier
bio: French chemist known as the 'father of modern chemistry'.

name: Planck
bio: German physicist who originated quantum theory.

name: Heisenberg
bio: German physicist and pioneer of quantum mechanics.

name: Fermi
bio: Italian-American physicist who created the first nuclear reactor.

name: Bohr
bio: Danish physicist who made foundational contributions to understanding atomic structure.

name: Dirac
bio: English physicist who made fundamental contributions to quantum mechanics.

name: Schrodinger
bio: Austrian physicist known for his contributions to quantum theory.

name: Rutherford
bio: New Zealand-born physicist who became known as the father of nuclear physics.

name: Marconi
bio: Italian inventor and electrical engineer known for his work on long-distance radio transmission.

name: Eddington
bio: English astronomer, physicist, and mathematician known for his work on the theory of relativity.

name: Hubble
bio: American astronomer who played a crucial role in establishing the field of extragalactic astronomy.

name: Oppenheimer
bio: American theoretical physicist and 'father of the atomic bomb'.

name: Watson
bio: American molecular biologist, geneticist, and zoologist, co-discoverer of DNA structure.

name: Crick
bio: British molecular biologist, biophysicist, and neuroscientist, co-discoverer of DNA structure.

name: Bell
bio: Scottish-born inventor of the telephone and pioneer in communication technology.

name: Edison
bio: American inventor known for the phonograph and the practical incandescent light bulb.

name: Tesla
bio: Serbian-American engineer and inventor known for his work with AC electricity.

name: Marconi
bio: Italian inventor and electrical engineer known for his work on long-distance radio transmission.

name: Wright
bio: American aviation pioneers credited with inventing and building the world's first successful airplane.

name: Ford
bio: American industrialist and founder of the Ford Motor Company, revolutionized automobile manufacturing.

name: Lovelace
bio: English mathematician considered the first computer programmer for her work on Babbage's Analytical Engine.

name: Franklin
bio: American polymath known for his discoveries in electricity and inventions like the lightning rod.

name: Curie
bio: Polish-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity.

name: Pasteur
bio: French biologist renowned for his discoveries of vaccination and pasteurization.

name: Mendel
bio: Austrian scientist and monk, founder of the modern science of genetics.

name: Fleming
bio: Scottish bacteriologist who discovered penicillin.

name: Salk
bio: American medical researcher who developed the first successful polio vaccine.

name: Einstein
bio: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity.

name: Newton
bio: English mathematician and physicist who formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

name: Darwin
bio: English naturalist known for his contributions to evolutionary biology.

name: Galilei
bio: Italian astronomer, physicist, and engineer known as the 'father of observational astronomy'.

name: Copernicus
bio: Renaissance-era mathematician who formulated a model of the universe placing the Sun at its center.

name: Kepler
bio: German astronomer known for his laws of planetary motion.

name: Faraday
bio: English scientist who contributed to the study of electromagnetism.
